nodes.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 4          |
-------------------------------


The horde rides swiftly across the plateau. In the front, the Chief in his jeep. 
Horses loaded with weapons and men form clouds of dust, galloping spurred by their riders. 

You are in the rearguard, sharing a horse with Smiurl. Corolla and Theo are right ahead. 

You never thought riding could be so frustrating. 
You fear that when you'll get back on the ground# (if you will ever do),
someone will have to very mercifully put all of your pieces back together. 
You feel every jolt in your bones; your ears are full of the shouts coming from that bunch of... 
You don't even know $Wwhat$C they are. 

And what about Smiurl's own shouts?# Uncomprehensible noise. 


After what it feels like an eternity to you, that mess starts to wane. 
The horses slow down, ending up scattered along the edge of a canyon. 
It quite suddenly cuts everybody off. A long wound scarring the wide, rocky, semi-desert, plain.

You watch from the distance the Chief jumping on the hood of the car. 
You couldn't identify the model so far, it must be custom made or heavily customised. 
He starts talking loudly:

$M"The $Wprey$M will get here shortly after sunset. We'll attack them as fast as lightining,
and we'll have them defeated before they can even reach out for a spear!"#$C

A roar rises from the rabble. 

$c<<What am I doing among these thugs?>>#$C You go back asking yourself. 
Are you about to witness another slaughter?#

$M"The vanguard and I will hide in that cove; the rest of you will be lying in wait here and there, on the other side."$C
He points to the other side of the chasm. 

$M"When you'll see us attack from the front, you'll rush down at break-neck speed,
possibly making a heck of a noise, and deprive them of any escape route." $CAnd he laughs hard. 

$M"See ya!" $CHe salutes with an happy gesture, as if all of you are about to go for a merry trip to the lake. 
You watch him rumble down the craggy stone wall rising a big cloud of dust,
followed by a significant number of the horsemen.

dialogues.precomment: You are still a bit dazed, when Corolla and Theo catch up with you two.
You don't understand what's going on.

dialogues.line:
It happens that 'a good, healthy battle' is about to start, as the Chief would say. 
But this time, there's something he does not know. 
For too long he had us all dwell in a snake pit... 
And now, he's gonna reap the betrayal he himself sowed.

dialogues.precomment:
You still don't understand. 
Somehow your face must make that clear, because Corolla starts again, in a milder tone:
dialogues.line: Many in the horde are tired of his leadership. Think about Jeorghe: many others here are just like him.
Each of which would gladly take the three... four of us out!
dialogues.comment: Adds Smiurl, who was quiet so far.

dialogues.line:
And not just us; these thugs have an appetite for killing. 
I cannot stand watching any more villages be burnt to the ground.
dialogues.comment:
She clenches her fists and her jaw,
embers in her eyes.

dialogues.line:
Now, there's no time to explain to you how we ended up with these guys. 
We wanted to warn the Chief about the mutiny plans that are being devised,
but Jeorghe and his friends prevented us... Then you arrived out of nowhere... 
Long story short: all we can do now is hide and hope they won't trouble themselves too much looking for us.

nodes.text:
You are still taking in what Corolla explained to you, when you reach a cave on the side of the ravine. 
Its access isn't directly visible from where the others are waiting to ambush. 

You prepare to wait.

actions.answer:
The sun is sinking down, slowly and relentlessly, anxious and tremulous,
ready to be swallowed up into night's unfathomed lair,
giving way to her uncountable shiny emissaries. 

Alien gleams dance on the horizon, as the strongest rays run the last race,
darkening on the way and turning the reddish wasteland in a huge tapestry,
where the armed men are nothing more than maybe-dreamed shapes.

Not the slightest sound disturbs the absolute calm and silence now reigning in the canyon. 
All you can hear is your own blood flowing inside of your ears,
as well as your heartbeat. 

For all you know, Theo, Corolla and Smiurl could even have stopped breathing.

The twilight gleam fades away. Darkness grows thicker. 

At once, a distant sound. It must be the caravan you are waiting for. 

Time seems to further slow down its pace. You can feel the seconds trickle through your fingers as mercury, liquid,
painstakingly seeping through and then falling down, with unbearable slowness,
almost hesitating, and, in the end, dying on the ground with a thud.

nodes.text:
You start hearing a distant noise. It must be the convoy. 

After few more endless minutes spent listening to that noise increase,
you and the others peek outside. 
Down there are a dozen of big slow transports. Some of them are pulled by horses, others by motor vehicles. 
They are escorted by many horsemen. 

Without delay, the attack begins. 
Shouts arise in the canyon, echoing countless times on the stone walls, confounding the enemy. 
Then the Chief's roaring jeep charges, suddenly appearing out of its hiding place. 
The entire convoy halts suddenly, and the defensors spread aroud the first chariots. 

The stranglehold works, as the rest of the horde attacks them from their back. 
The noise now saturates the canyon like water in a bottle. 

Soon it's over. The attackers are taking out the very last men, when Corolla says alarmed:

$R"Wait a second!# What is this noise...??"##

A gloomy vibration is quickly increasing, propagating through the canyon, echoing between the rocks. 

Suddenly, a high sound blares all around; all the fighters stop, looking around puzzled. 

Abruptly, the ringing, deafening horn-like sound stops, giving way to silence once more. 

And, quietly, silently, the edges of the canyon start getting filled with lights. 
They appear gradually, randomly, in different sizes and colours. 
They look like $Ywisps, $Rignis $Bfatuuses, $Gslowly $Mswaying $caround. 


$CYou shudder.

$S$KThe darkness gets bluntly ripped apart by a shaft of light,
pure white refracting in the whole color spectrum,
blinding you completely. 

There is no use in shutting your eyes, as the light seems to directly reach into your mind. 

A lot of commotion follows. When your eyes start to work again you assist to the slaughtering. 
The lights attack somehow everybody in the canyon, the horde as well as the men of the convoy. 

$s$CIt's all very quick. 
Blinded and panicking, nodoby seems to escape. After few minutes, it's all over. 

The lights are rushing and fading away in the distance already, leaving only a dead silence behind...

You all stay hidden for a while. When you are sure it's 'safe', you cautiously go outside. 

The chariots lie abandoned, their torches still lit. Their scattered faint light reveals aspects of the scene. 

It seems there's no survivor; from this distance it's hard to say. 

$B"Let's look for survivors."#$C Theo says, unsurprisingly. His voice sounds like he does not believe he'll find any. 

You follow them, not knowing what to think, once again. 

As you descend, you encounter an increasing number of bodies. You are just thankful it's dark:
you won't have their terrified expressions imprinted in your memory forever. 

You all go towards a plume of smoke rising from behind a big boulder. 
Behind there is the Chief's jeep, which upholstery is feeding the flames you saw. 

$Y"The Chief!"$C Smiurl shouts out. 

Then you see him. Sitting on the ground, his back against the front fender. 
He must be dying; he's losing a lot of blood from a conspicuous wound in his chest. 
Not just you, also Corolla, Theo and Smiurl freeze looking at him, not knowing what to say. 
Thus it surprises you, the fact that after few instants you step forward. 

The Chief slowly lift his chin looking at you, and, despite everything, he manages to grin.

$M"Were you a spy after all...?" $CHe coughs, blood leaking from the corner of his mouth. 
Then he seems to notice the others:

$M"I should have expected this..."$C He looks back at you, and after taking one painful breath,
he smirks one more time, then adds:

$M"Young man, what about... avenging me..."$C# But his last words die this way along with his last breath. 

You all stand there still, unable to do anything. 
After all you witnessed since you arrived in this place, you feel like you have just reached the point of no return. 
You feel like something in you mind just cracked. Like you're losing touch with reality. 

Then, it happens. 

$cYou find yourself walking towards him. You feel like you're projected outside of your own body,
as if $Gsomeone else$c is moving your muscles. 
You lean on him and absent-mindedly observe your own hands untying his sword from his side. 
Next thing you notice, you are wielding it, pointed to the sky, staring at the blade glinting with ominous glares. 


$CIn the meantime, Smiurl has retracted in himself, gaining a brownish hue. 
Theo is back to being impassible as usal. 
For some reason, Corolla seems to approve your actions and retrieves the Chief's chain.

You suddenly come back to your senses. You return to feel the ground beneath your feet,
the air of the night against your skin, the glances of the other three,
the mighty weight of the sword, too long and heavy to be wielded with one hand only. 

You immediately put it down with the tip in the ground, then you lean with your own weight on it. 

$R"Are you ok...?"#$C Asks you Corolla, putting a hand on your shoulder. 

$c"Huh? I think... I think I am..."#$C You answer. But you have no idea what just happened. 

$B"We camp here, until daybreak."#$C Theo deliberates, walking back to the cave.
